subject: Re: (3.8) NullPointerException from ComparisonFailure
msgSnippet: ... I saw a patch somewhere but can t remember where... so here s the quick patch I made: in the AssertTest class: public void
messageBody:
> I will be quite happy to patch this if this has not already
> been done, but don't wish to duplicate work if it already
> has been done.

I saw a patch somewhere but can't remember where... so here's the
quick patch I made:

in the AssertTest class:

public void testComparisonErrorNullExpected() {
ComparisonFailure failure= new ComparisonFailure("Msg", null,
"abcde");
assertEquals("Msg expected:<null> but was:<abcde>",
failure.getMessage());
}

public void testComparisonErrorNullActual() {
ComparisonFailure failure= new ComparisonFailure("Msg", "abcde",
null);
assertEquals("Msg expected:<abcde> but was:<null>",
failure.getMessage());
}

and in the ComparisonFailure file, line 33:

if (fExpected == null) {
if (message != null)
formatted= message+" ";
return formatted+"expected:<null> but was:<"+fActual+">";
}
if (fActual == null) {
if (message != null)
formatted= message+" ";
return formatted+"expected:<"+fExpected+"> but
was:<null>";
}

You'll have to recompile JUnit (of course) to take advantage of the
fix.

I added this patch on the JUnit project page

-Vladimir
